game.quest

Class GSQuest

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.quest.GSQuest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGameState, StdIO.IKeyListener

    public class GSQuest
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGameState, StdIO.IKeyListener
    Author:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GSQuest() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getSolution(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> solutions)
      takes an IntegerElement from the ArrayList solutions and checks if it equals to the y.coordinate of the rectangle
      if it does, the method returns "true" else it returns "false"
      void onEnter()
      when entering the QUEST-gameState
      - the keyListener is added
      - the default questState is initialized
      - the required txt.files are stored in ArrayLists
      void onExit()
      when leaving the QUEST-gameState:
      - the keyListener is removed
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readDialog(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> list, java.lang.String path)
      reads out a txt.file line by line and stores the lines as Strings in an ArrayList
      void receiveEvent(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      waits for a keyboard input by the user
      allows the following keys:
      "Enter", "W", "S", "UP", "DOWN" depending on the pressed key one of the following options kicks in:
      - the QUEST-gameState is left
      - the rectangle is moved vertically
      - the selcted answer is checked for correctness
      void render()
      draws texts from the ArrayLists sphinxRiddle/response on the screen depending on the active questState
      when in questState 3 it draws a rectangle for selecting an answer
      void update() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public void receiveEvent(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        waits for a keyboard input by the user
        allows the following keys:
        "Enter", "W", "S", "UP", "DOWN" depending on the pressed key one of the following options kicks in:
        - the QUEST-gameState is left
        - the rectangle is moved vertically
        - the selcted answer is checked for correctness

      • readDialog

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readDialog(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> list,
                                               java.lang.String path)
        reads out a txt.file line by line and stores the lines as Strings in an ArrayList
        Parameters:
        list - the name of the ArrayList in which the Strings are saved
        path - the path where the txt.file lies
        Returns:

      • getSolution

        public boolean getSolution(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> solutions)
        takes an IntegerElement from the ArrayList solutions and checks if it equals to the y.coordinate of the rectangle
        if it does, the method returns "true" else it returns "false"
        Parameters:
        solutions - the ArrayList in which the solutions for the riddles are saved
        Returns:
